CrystalUnityBasic Class Reference

The interface to all of the Crystal SDK functionality. More...

List of all members.

Public Types

enum  ActivateUiType {
  StandardUi, ProfileUi, ChallengesUi, LeaderboardsUi,
  AchievementsUi, AddFriends, Settings, Gifting,
  VirtualGoods, VirtualCurrencies
}
 

The section (tab) of the Crystal UI to display to the user by default.

More...
enum  CrystalSetting {
  CrystalSettingCocosAchievementWorkaround = 1, CrystalSettingAvoidBackgroundActivity = 2, CrystalSettingShouldAutorotateWorkaround = 3, CrystalSettingSingleiPadPopover = 4,
  CrystalSettingEnableGameCenterSupport = 5
}
 

Crystal settings that enable workaround functionality within the system. You should only enable these settings if you're seeing a specific problem that you think may be resolved by one of these options. In general you will be instructed to use one of these settings by an FAQ article or directly by the Crystal SDK support team.

More...

Public Member Functions

void Start ()
void Update ()
bool AppWasStartedFromPendingChallenge ()
 Ask the session whether the application was started from an incoming challenge (push) notification.
bool HaveIncomingChallengeFromCrystal ()
 Ask the session whether there is an incoming challenge from the Crystal UI. This will occur when the user initiates a challenge from the Crystal UI and reactivates the game.
void ActivateUi ()
void ActivateUi (CrystalUnityBasic.ActivateUiType type)
void ActivateUiAtLeadboardWithId (string leaderboardId)
 Activate the Crystal UI at a specific leaderboard.
void DeactivateUi ()
void PostChallengeResultForLastChallenge (double result, bool doDialog)
 Post the result of the last challenge that the game was notified for The game will be notified of the challenge via the challengeStartedWithGameConfig: method of CrystalSessionDelegate.
void PostAchievement (string achievementId, bool wasObtained, string description, bool alwaysPopup)
 Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
void PostLeaderboardResult (string leaderboardId, float result, bool lowestValFirst)
 Notify the Crystal servers of a leaderboard result for the specified leaderboard ID. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding unneeded posts is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever a score is scored. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
void PostAchievement (string achievementId, bool wasObtained, string description, bool alwaysPopup, string gcAchievementId)
 Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
void PostLeaderboardResult (string leaderboardId, float result, bool lowestValFirst, string gcLeaderboardId)
 Notify the Crystal servers of a leaderboard result for the specified leaderboard ID. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding unneeded posts is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever a score is scored. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
void PostAchievementProgressWithId (string crystalId, string gameCenterId, double percentageComplete, string achievementDescription)
 Report progress made towards an achievement both to Crystal and Game Center This method updates the Crystal UI to show the progress that the player has made towards an achievement in plain text. This method also updates Game Center to report the percentage complete for the achievement. Achievement popups are not shown if this method is called.
void LockToOrientation (iPhoneScreenOrientation orientation)
 Lock the crystal interface to the specified interface orientation This method will override any call to lockToOrientation: in AppController+Crystal.mm Supported orientations are Portrait, LandscapeLeft and LandscapeRight.
void DisplaySplashScreen ()
 Displays the Crystal splash screen This method displays the Crystal splash screen to the user above the current game UI. It is the responsibility of the developer to ensure that this dialog is displayed at an appropriate time, generally just after the game is started. When the splash screen has been dismissed splashScreenFinishedWithActivateCrystal: will be called in the delegate. Normally the game would only display this splash screen once to the user.
void ActivateCrystalSetting (CrystalSetting setting, string settingValue)
 Sets values for various internal Crystal settings. This method is provided for developers to activate workarounds for bugs on the iPhone and the graphics libraries used by developers.
void AuthenticateLocalPlayer ()
 Call this after your game has loaded to initiate login to Game Center Calling this method can initiate the Game Center login dialog, so ensure that you call this at a suitable moment. After the user has signed up to Game Center this method will display a 'welcome back' overlay. At the time of writing (iOS 4.1 beta 3) the iOS APIs used by this method must be called before scores and achievements can be posted. As a result of this you must be careful of the timing of this call.
void CloseCrystalSession ()
 Closes the Crystal session. This should only be called when absolutely necessary for memory usage reasons. The Crystal session without the UI is very small, so this should cause no problems. Without a running sesssion high scores, achievements and analytics will not be posted to the server.
void WillRotateToInterfaceWithOrientation (iPhoneScreenOrientation orientation, double orientationDuration)
void DidRotateFromInterfaceOrientation (iPhoneScreenOrientation orientation)
void DownloadLeaderBoardDataForID (string leaderboardId)
 Initiate the download of leaderboard data for the supplied leaderboard ID If the leaderboard data for the specified leaderboardID is already downloaded for this game session the data will not be updated from the server to avoid excessive server load. When the leaderboard data has been downloaded the crystalLeaderboardUpdated: method will be called on CrystalLeaderboardDelegate. There is no indication of an error while downloading the leaderboard data and there is no need to manually retry the process.
void PostVirtualGoods (IDictionary< string, int > goods)
 Post changes to the user's virtual goods record back to the server Use this method to post one or more changes to the user's virtual goods to the server. Changes will only be made to the virtual good that are supplied, and more than one virtual good can be updated at once. There is no need to replicate the information stored in the goods property in full. To avoid server load it is recommended to combine changes into one call by adding the info to the same dictionary. To remove the good from the user supply a 0 for the number of goods owned. When the virtual goods have been updated the client will be informed via crystalVirtualGoodsInfoUpdatedWithSuccess: and the results reflected in the goods property.
void SetLockedGoods (IList< string > lockedGoods)
 Set a list of goods that are not selectable and are shown with a 'locked' icon in the Crystal UI This method works differently from postGoods: and postBalances: in that it's not possible to 'update' items peacemeal. The client must send all locked goods in one call, and can remove the locks by passing nil as the parameter.
void PostVirtualBalances (IDictionary< string, int > balances)
 Post changes to the user's balances back to the server Use this method to post one or more changes to the user's wallet balances to the server. Changes will only be made to the balances that are supplied, and more than one balance can be updated at once. There is no need to replicate the information stored in the balances property in full. To avoid server load it is recommended to combine changes into one call by adding the info to the same dictionary. When the virtual currencies have been updated the client will be informed via crystalVirtualGoodsInfoUpdatedWithSuccess: and the results reflected in the goods property.
void CrystalPlayerStartUpdating ()
 Instructs the SDK to start keeping the CrystalPlayer class up-to-date with the current player's info Because this method initiates network traffic and server load it is important that apps refrain from calling the method unless the CrystalPlayer data is used.
void VirtualGoodsStartUpdating ()
 Instructs the SDK to start keeping the CrystalPlayer class up-to-date with the current player's info Because this method initiates network traffic and server load it is important that apps refrain from calling the method unless the CrystalPlayer data is used.
void VirtualGoodsUpdateNow ()
 Instructs the SDK to update the CrystalVirtualGoods info as soon as possible Ordinarily any activity relating to virtual goods or currencies inside the Crystal UI will automatically instruct CrystalVirtualGoods to update itself. The same is true when using APIs like postGoods:. If a post fails the client should always retry via the post calls and not call updateNow. updateNow will retrieve updated information from the server and any information previously posted will be lost. It should be rare that the client will need to call this method but it is added for completeness.
bool IsCrystalPlayerSignedIn ()
 returns true is the user is currently signed into Crystal

Detailed Description

The interface to all of the Crystal SDK functionality.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CrystalUnityBasic::ActivateUiType

The section (tab) of the Crystal UI to display to the user by default.

Enumerator:
StandardUi 

Opens up the Crystal UI at the default tab on iPhone and without and popovers open on iPad.

ProfileUi 

Opens up the Profile tab.

ChallengesUi 

Opens up the Challenges tab.

LeaderboardsUi 

Opens up the Leaderboards tab.

AchievementsUi 

Opens up the Achievements tab.

AddFriends 

Opens up the AddFriends tab.

Settings 

Opens up the Settings tab.

Gifting 

Opens up the Gifting tab.

VirtualGoods 

Opens up the Virtual Goods tab.

VirtualCurrencies 

Opens up the Virtual Currencies tab.

enum CrystalUnityBasic::CrystalSetting

Crystal settings that enable workaround functionality within the system. You should only enable these settings if you're seeing a specific problem that you think may be resolved by one of these options. In general you will be instructed to use one of these settings by an FAQ article or directly by the Crystal SDK support team.

Enumerator:
CrystalSettingCocosAchievementWorkaround 

Activate the CrystalSettingCocosAchievementWorkaround setting if you're seeing a vertical bar instead of the achievement popup. value:"YES" activates the setting.

CrystalSettingAvoidBackgroundActivity 

Activate the CrystalSettingAvoidBackgroundActivity setting if you're seeing occasional slowdowns during high-CPU activity. This setting is intended to be used sparingly during 3D cut scenes and similar and will affect achievement posting etc. The setting should be returned to the NO state as soon as possible and the NO state should be the game's default. No user data should be lost while the setting is set to NO however. value:"YES" - Crystal will avoid any background processing or network activity. value:"NO" - Return Crystal to its default state.

CrystalSettingShouldAutorotateWorkaround 

Activate this setting for framework crashes in [UIWindow _shouldAutorotateToInterfaceOrientation:]. You'll most commonly see this problem while rotating the device in projects with no UIViewController instance such as purely OpenGL-based games. value:"YES" activates this setting.

CrystalSettingSingleiPadPopover 

Activate this setting to restrict Crystal on iPad to one popover, rather than the hierarchical popover method. The hierarchical popoevers are more visually appealing but ma contradict some recent Apple Human Interface Guideline changes. value:"YES" activates this setting.

CrystalSettingEnableGameCenterSupport 

Activate this setting to enable the Game Center support within Crystal. This setting can be called as a result of an enable/disable Game Center switch in the game UI if desired. value:"YES" activates this setting.

Member Function Documentation

void CrystalUnityBasic::ActivateCrystalSetting ( CrystalSetting  setting,
string  settingValue 
) [inline]

Sets values for various internal Crystal settings. This method is provided for developers to activate workarounds for bugs on the iPhone and the graphics libraries used by developers.

Parameters:
setting the CrystalSetting to set
settingValue the value to set for this setting, which will generally be "YES" to activate a setting

void CrystalUnityBasic::AuthenticateLocalPlayer (  )  [inline]

Call this after your game has loaded to initiate login to Game Center Calling this method can initiate the Game Center login dialog, so ensure that you call this at a suitable moment. After the user has signed up to Game Center this method will display a 'welcome back' overlay. At the time of writing (iOS 4.1 beta 3) the iOS APIs used by this method must be called before scores and achievements can be posted. As a result of this you must be careful of the timing of this call.

void CrystalUnityBasic::CloseCrystalSession (  )  [inline]

Closes the Crystal session. This should only be called when absolutely necessary for memory usage reasons. The Crystal session without the UI is very small, so this should cause no problems. Without a running sesssion high scores, achievements and analytics will not be posted to the server.

void CrystalUnityBasic::CrystalPlayerStartUpdating (  )  [inline]

Instructs the SDK to start keeping the CrystalPlayer class up-to-date with the current player's info Because this method initiates network traffic and server load it is important that apps refrain from calling the method unless the CrystalPlayer data is used.

void CrystalUnityBasic::DeactivateUi (  )  [inline]

Deactivates the Crystal UI at the specified UI area where possible

Parameters:
type The ActivateUiType as specified above
void CrystalUnityBasic::DisplaySplashScreen (  )  [inline]

Displays the Crystal splash screen This method displays the Crystal splash screen to the user above the current game UI. It is the responsibility of the developer to ensure that this dialog is displayed at an appropriate time, generally just after the game is started. When the splash screen has been dismissed splashScreenFinishedWithActivateCrystal: will be called in the delegate. Normally the game would only display this splash screen once to the user.

void CrystalUnityBasic::DownloadLeaderBoardDataForID ( string  leaderboardId  )  [inline]

Initiate the download of leaderboard data for the supplied leaderboard ID If the leaderboard data for the specified leaderboardID is already downloaded for this game session the data will not be updated from the server to avoid excessive server load. When the leaderboard data has been downloaded the crystalLeaderboardUpdated: method will be called on CrystalLeaderboardDelegate. There is no indication of an error while downloading the leaderboard data and there is no need to manually retry the process.

void CrystalUnityBasic::PostAchievement ( string  achievementId,
bool  wasObtained,
string  description,
bool  alwaysPopup 
) [inline]

Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.

Parameters:
achievementId The ID of the achievement as shown in the Crystal control panel
wasObtained true if the achievement has been obtained or NO to 'unobtain' it.
description A description of the achievement to be displayed to the user. Supplying the description here allows the developer to localize the description. Crystal may not necessarily have a network connection so the only way to get the achievement description is here. If no desctiption is supplied then no notification will be displayed to the user.
alwaysPopup if true the achievement popup will always be displayed to the user. If false (the most common choice) the popup will only be displayed the first time that the achievement is achieved.
void CrystalUnityBasic::PostAchievement ( string  achievementId,
bool  wasObtained,
string  description,
bool  alwaysPopup,
string  gcAchievementId 
) [inline]

Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.

Parameters:
achievementId The ID of the achievement as shown in the Crystal control panel
wasObtained true if the achievement has been obtained or NO to 'unobtain' it.
description A description of the achievement to be displayed to the user. Supplying the description here allows the developer to localize the description. Crystal may not necessarily have a network connection so the only way to get the achievement description is here. If no desctiption is supplied then no notification will be displayed to the user.
alwaysPopup if true the achievement popup will always be displayed to the user. If false (the most common choice) the popup will only be displayed the first time that the achievement is achieved.
gcAchievementId The ID of the achievement as shown in the Crystal control panel
void CrystalUnityBasic::PostAchievementProgressWithId ( string  crystalId,
string  gameCenterId,
double  percentageComplete,
string  achievementDescription 
) [inline]

Report progress made towards an achievement both to Crystal and Game Center This method updates the Crystal UI to show the progress that the player has made towards an achievement in plain text. This method also updates Game Center to report the percentage complete for the achievement. Achievement popups are not shown if this method is called.

Parameters:
crystalId The ID of the achievement as shown in the Crystal control panel
gameCenterId The ID of the Game Center achievement to use. This will be defined in iTunes Connect for the application.
percentageComplete The percentage complete for the achievement, i.e. 40.0 (passed to Game Center)
achievementDescription A textual description of the achievement progress, i.e. "4 out of 10 coins collected" (shown in Crystal UI)
void CrystalUnityBasic::PostChallengeResultForLastChallenge ( double  result,
bool  doDialog 
) [inline]

Post the result of the last challenge that the game was notified for The game will be notified of the challenge via the challengeStartedWithGameConfig: method of CrystalSessionDelegate.

Parameters:
result The result of the challenge, either as a numerical value or as a number of seconds for time-based scores
doDialog If true Crystal will display a dialog over the game user interface
void CrystalUnityBasic::PostLeaderboardResult ( string  leaderboardId,
float  result,
bool  lowestValFirst 
) [inline]

Notify the Crystal servers of a leaderboard result for the specified leaderboard ID. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding unneeded posts is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever a score is scored. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.

Parameters:
result The score to publish, either as a numerical value or as a number of seconds for time-based scores
leaderboardId The ID of the leaderboard to post to, which should be taken from the Developer Dashboard
lowestValFirst Set this if you have YES set for lowest value first in the developer dashboard. This parameter MUST match the flag in the developer dashboard!
void CrystalUnityBasic::PostLeaderboardResult ( string  leaderboardId,
float  result,
bool  lowestValFirst,
string  gcLeaderboardId 
) [inline]

Notify the Crystal servers of a leaderboard result for the specified leaderboard ID. The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding unneeded posts is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever a score is scored. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.

Parameters:
result The score to publish, either as a numerical value or as a number of seconds for time-based scores
leaderboardId The ID of the leaderboard to post to, which should be taken from the Developer Dashboard
lowestValFirst Set this if you have YES set for lowest value first in the developer dashboard. This parameter MUST match the flag in the developer dashboard!
gcLeaderboardId The ID of the Game Center leaderboard to post to, which should be taken from the Developer Dashboard
void CrystalUnityBasic::PostVirtualBalances ( IDictionary< string, int >  balances  )  [inline]

Post changes to the user's balances back to the server Use this method to post one or more changes to the user's wallet balances to the server. Changes will only be made to the balances that are supplied, and more than one balance can be updated at once. There is no need to replicate the information stored in the balances property in full. To avoid server load it is recommended to combine changes into one call by adding the info to the same dictionary. When the virtual currencies have been updated the client will be informed via crystalVirtualGoodsInfoUpdatedWithSuccess: and the results reflected in the goods property.

Parameters:
balances The format of the information supplied is a dictionary, where the key is the currency ID (string) and the value is the balance (int).
void CrystalUnityBasic::PostVirtualGoods ( IDictionary< string, int >  goods  )  [inline]

Post changes to the user's virtual goods record back to the server Use this method to post one or more changes to the user's virtual goods to the server. Changes will only be made to the virtual good that are supplied, and more than one virtual good can be updated at once. There is no need to replicate the information stored in the goods property in full. To avoid server load it is recommended to combine changes into one call by adding the info to the same dictionary. To remove the good from the user supply a 0 for the number of goods owned. When the virtual goods have been updated the client will be informed via crystalVirtualGoodsInfoUpdatedWithSuccess: and the results reflected in the goods property.

Parameters:
goods The format of the information supplied is a dictionary, where the key is the virtual good ID (string) and the value is the number of goods owned (int).
void CrystalUnityBasic::SetLockedGoods ( IList< string >  lockedGoods  )  [inline]

Set a list of goods that are not selectable and are shown with a 'locked' icon in the Crystal UI This method works differently from postGoods: and postBalances: in that it's not possible to 'update' items peacemeal. The client must send all locked goods in one call, and can remove the locks by passing nil as the parameter.

Parameters:
lockedGoods An NSSet of NSString good IDs to lock or null to remove any locks
void CrystalUnityBasic::VirtualGoodsStartUpdating (  )  [inline]

Instructs the SDK to start keeping the CrystalPlayer class up-to-date with the current player's info Because this method initiates network traffic and server load it is important that apps refrain from calling the method unless the CrystalPlayer data is used.

void CrystalUnityBasic::VirtualGoodsUpdateNow (  )  [inline]

Instructs the SDK to update the CrystalVirtualGoods info as soon as possible Ordinarily any activity relating to virtual goods or currencies inside the Crystal UI will automatically instruct CrystalVirtualGoods to update itself. The same is true when using APIs like postGoods:. If a post fails the client should always retry via the post calls and not call updateNow. updateNow will retrieve updated information from the server and any information previously posted will be lost. It should be rare that the client will need to call this method but it is added for completeness.
